meanings.definition: The smallest amount or quantity possible.
meanings.sent1: I only need a minimum of sugar for this recipe.
meanings.sent2: She earned the minimum wage for her part-time job.
meanings.sent3: At the party, the host set a minimum of two cookies per guest.
meanings.sent4: His patience was stretched to the minimum as he waited for the bus.
meanings.sent5: The teacher emphasized the importance of studying for a minimum of two hours each day.

meanings.sent1: The company set a minimum for the number of products to be sold each month.
meanings.sent2: He always aimed to achieve the minimum required score in his exams.
meanings.sent3: The chef used the minimum amount of salt in the soup, but it was still flavorful.
meanings.sent4: Her energy level was at a minimum after a long day at work.
meanings.sent5: The team celebrated reaching the minimum goal for their fundraising campaign.
